title: Fleur-de-lis

nouns: A flower of any of the species belonging to the genus Iris; the flowers occur in many colors, have long and slender pointed leaves, and either a corm or a rhizome.
Any of various plants with sword-shaped leaves, especially irises; specifically, Iris pseudacorus.
Plants with sword-shaped leaves and erect stalks bearing bright-colored flowers composed of three petals and three drooping sepals
A plant of the genus Iris, common in the northern hemisphere, and generally having attractive blooms (Wikipedia).
Iris is a genus of 260 -- 300 species of flowering plants with showy flowers.
Person on watch for approaching enemy, police, etc.
A person on a ship in charge of the observation of the sea for hazards, other ships, land, etc.., or a criminal observer
A person on watch for approaching enemy, police, etc.
A lookout or look-out is a person on a ship in charge of the observation of the sea for hazards, other ships, land, etc.
A person employed to keep watch for some anticipated event

description: A decorative symbol that appears like a golden flower, but found in all manner of logos, symbols, and patterns. This symbol forms part of the World Scout Emblem, amongst other uses.
apple_vendor_description: The fleur-de-lis emoji on Apple devices is a stylized lily, rendered with a regal and elegant design that highlights Apple's meticulous attention to detail. Its metallic sheen, often in a rich gold or silver, is brought to life with realistic lighting and glossy 3D shading, giving it a tactile and luxurious feel. This symbol, with its soft, rounded petals, often represents royalty, honor, and religious significance, adding a touch of sophistication to any message.
